summary: The Coast Guard Authorization Act of 2025 covers a broad range of topics related to the Coast Guard and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). It authorizes appropriations for the Coast Guard, addresses acquisition needs (icebreakers, dry docks), and modifies various organizational authorities. Key areas include personnel matters (pay, leave, direct hire authority, Academy improvements), reporting requirements, shipping and navigation (mariner credentials, vessel safety, uncrewed systems), oil pollution response, and sexual assault/harassment response. The bill concludes with provisions for NOAA, including vessel fleet modernization and South Pacific Tuna Treaty matters.
